messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Links On Unschooling?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Katie, are you already homeschooling? If so, you don t need to contact anyone. As far as the state is concerned unschooling is a form of homeschooling.
messages.messageBody:
--- Katie <ohhxkatie@...> wrote:

> Can anyone email me some information on how to start
> unschooling.
> I don't know who i need to contact to begin this
> i'm in a desperate situation to start this and
> abandon normal
> homeschooling.
Katie, are you already homeschooling? If so, you don't
need to contact anyone. As far as the state is
concerned unschooling is a form of homeschooling. It's
a form that officials don't like. So most of us in
states that have strict reporting guidelines don't say
"unschooling" anywhere in our reporting. You should
find a local group to get details on reporting etc.

> the main things i need answered:
> how much does it cost?
> who do i need to contact?
> how do i start?
These questions make me think that you know absolutely
nothing about unschooling. Start by reading some
articles at these sites:

http://www.unschooling.info/articles.htm

Joyce's site : http://joyfullyrejoycing.com/

Sandra Dodd's site:
http://sandradodd.com/unschooling.html

There are also books on the subject:
The Unschooling Handbook by Mary Griffith is a book
that covers all the basics.

Manisha

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Links On Unschooling?

messages.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: Katie <ohhxkatie@...>

Can anyone email me some information on how to start unschooling.
I don't know who i need to contact to begin this
i'm in a desperate situation to start this and abandon normal
homeschooling.
the main things i need answered:
how much does it cost?

-=-=-=-=-

$20,000

-=-=-=-=-=-

who do i need to contact?

-==-=-=-=-

Just send said $20,000 in full (in small bills, please) to
Kelly Lovejoy
118 Steeplechase South
Columbia, SC 29209

-=-=-=-

how do i start?

-=-=-=-=-

Use whatever $$$ you have left to go on vacation.

<bwg>

Seriously, find the homeschool laws in your state.

Then just do "Step 3" <g> Go on vacation.


~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://www.LiveandLearnConference.org

messages.subject: Re: Links On Unschooling?
messages.msgSnippet: Katie, why are you in a desperate situation?  Even most school-at- homers take the summer off. First of all, what state are you in?  You should definitely look
messages.messageBody:
Katie, why are you in a desperate situation? Even most school-at-
homers take the summer off.

First of all, what state are you in? You should definitely look at
the law in your particular state, since all states differ. And there
may be someone here from your state who could recommend a more local
list for that sort of thing.

If you look at the left side of the page here at unschoolingbasics,
you can click on the Links and there you'll find lots of places to
read more about unschooling.

As far as cost and how to start, that is up to you. Unschooling is
basically living life doing what you and your kid/s enjoy. Maybe if
you can give some more detail, we can help with more specific answers.

-Christy M.


--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Katie" <ohhxkatie@...>
wrote:
>
> Can anyone email me some information on how to start unschooling.
> I don't know who i need to contact to begin this
> i'm in a desperate situation to start this and abandon normal
> homeschooling.
> the main things i need answered:
> how much does it cost?
> who do i need to contact?
> how do i start?
>

messages.subject: Re: Links On Unschooling?
messages.msgSnippet: ~~Can anyone email me some information on how to start unschooling. I don t know who i need to contact to begin this i m in a desperate situation to start this
messages.messageBody:
~~Can anyone email me some information on how to start unschooling.
I don't know who i need to contact to begin this
i'm in a desperate situation to start this and abandon normal
homeschooling.
the main things i need answered:
how much does it cost?
who do i need to contact?
how do i start?~~


First of all, this list exists to discuss the philosophy of
unschooling not tell you how to deal with legalities. Also, this list
has members from all over the U.S. and other countries so we couldn't
possibly answer any of the above questions without knowing more.

And lastly, unschooling is a form of homeschooling so you need to know
the homeschool law of your region or state. Unschooling costs whatever
you want to spend in order to entertain you and your children's
interests and passions.

Please read more about unschooling and find out your state laws. If
you give us more information about where you are, people here could
direct you to other websites or legal information so you can educate
yourself. We are not here to discuss legalities or state specific
information though, so conversation about that will need to happen
offlist. Thank you.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com
